Inferring a trajectory inference using cellTree with gibbs

Source: R/ti_celltree.R, R/ti_container.R
ti_celltree_gibbs.Rd

Will generate a trajectory using cellTree with gibbs. This method was wrapped inside a container.

ti_celltree_gibbs(docker = "stevedore" %in% rownames(installed.packages()),
  method = "Gibbs", sd_filter = 0.5, absolute_width = 0,
  width_scale_factor = 1.5, outlier_tolerance_factor = 0.1,
  rooting_method = "null", num_topics = 4, tot_iter = 200,
  tolerance = 1e-05)

ti_celltree_gibbs(docker = "stevedore" %in% rownames(installed.packages()),
  method = "Gibbs", sd_filter = 0.5, absolute_width = 0,
  width_scale_factor = 1.5, outlier_tolerance_factor = 0.1,
  rooting_method = "null", num_topics = 4, tot_iter = 200,
  tolerance = 1e-05)

Arguments

docker

Whether to use the docker container or the R wrapper
method

LDA inference method to use. Can be any unique prefix of ‘maptpx’, ‘Gibbs’ or ‘VEM’ (defaults to ‘maptpx’)
sd_filter

Standard-deviation threshold below which genes should be removed from the data.
absolute_width

Distance threshold below which a cell vertex is considered to be attached to a backbone vertex (see paper for more details). By default, this threshold is computed dynamically, based on the distance distribution for each branch.
width_scale_factor

A scaling factor for the dynamically-computed distance threshold (ignored if absolute_width is provided). Higher values will result in less branches in the backbone tree, while lower values might lead to a large number of backbone branches.
outlier_tolerance_factor

Proportion of vertices, out of the total number of vertices divided by the total number of branches, that can be left at the end of the backbone tree-building algorithm.
rooting_method

Method used to root the backbone tree. Must be one of: ‘null’, ‘longest.path’, ‘center.start.group’ or ‘average.start.group’. ‘longest.path' picks one end of the longest shortest-path between two vertices. 'center.start.group’ picks the vertex in the starting group with lowest mean-square-distance to the others. ‘average.start.group’ creates a new artificial vertex, as the average of all cells in the starting group. ‘null’ picks the best method based on the type of grouping and start group information available.
num_topics

The number of topics to fit in the model.
tot_iter

Number of iterations of the LDA inference.
tolerance

Tolerance values of the LDA inference.

Value

The trajectory model

Details

This methods was first wrapped inside R, see ti_celltree_gibbs

The method is described in: duVerle, D.A., Yotsukura, S., Nomura, S., Aburatani, H., Tsuda, K., 2016. CellTree: an R/bioconductor package to infer the hierarchical structure of cell populations from single-cell RNA-seq data. BMC Bioinformatics 17.

Contents

  • Value
